recommendations: Prioritize Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) scan for suspected Pulmonary Embolism (PE) due to severe CKD and hemodynamic instability.
If CT Pulmonary Angiography (CTPA) is essential, implement modified protocol with low-osmolar, low-iodine contrast, limited volume (<= 40 mL), low kVp, and iterative reconstruction.
Obtain bedside transthoracic echocardiogram to assess for right ventricular strain, aiding PE diagnosis without contrast.
Stabilize blood pressure with vasopressors and manage hyperkalemia urgently before any contrast administration.
rationale: Patient has Stage 4 CKD (eGFR 22) and hypotension (MAP 57 mmHg), significantly increasing risk for contrast-induced nephropathy and hemodynamic compromise.
Hyperkalemia (K+ 5.8 mEq/L) requires immediate management prior to contrast use.
Anemia (Hb 9.5 g/dL) may necessitate transfusion consideration before procedures.
V/Q scan is the preferred first-line modality for PE in patients with severe renal impairment.
Modified CTPA protocol aims to minimize contrast volume and nephrotoxicity.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~100–150 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual. **MODIFIED DOSE REQUIRED DUE TO CKD AND HYPOTENSION**
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ensure contrast-to-eGFR ratio <1.1 g/(mL/min); if eGFR <30, consider non-contrast alternatives or weigh risks carefully. **PATIENT HAS STAGE 4 CKD AND IS HYPOTENSIVE, REQUIRES SIGNIFICANT DOSE REDUCTION AND CAUTION.**

protocol_selection.name: Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) Scan
protocol_selection.description: Radioisotope imaging to assess ventilation and perfusion of the lungs, useful for PE diagnosis, particularly in renal dysfunction.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ideal for patients with severe CKD and contraindications to iodinated contrast agents.
